name: AWS Service Log
title: AWS Service Log Pipelines
deleteTips: Are you sure you want to delete the service log

cluster.aosDomainDesc1: Select an imported cluster. You must
cluster.aosDomainDesc3: before you select from the list.
cluster.sampleDashboardDesc: Create a predefined sample dashboard in OpenSearch Dashboards.
cluster.indexPrefixDesc2: . You can choose a different suffix to adjust the index rollover time window. For example, if you select “YYYY-MM-DD-HH” suffix, OpenSearch will rollover the index by hour.
cluster.warmLogDesc1: Move aged logs from hot storage to warm storage to save cost. You must enable
cluster.coldLogDesc1: Move aged logs from warm storage to cold storage to save cost. You must enable
cluster.logRetentionDesc: Delete aged logs from OpenSearch domain.
cluster.shardNumDesc: Specify the number of shards to distribute index evenly across all data nodes, keep the size of each shard between 10-50GB.
cluster.replicaNumDesc: Number of replicas for OpenSearch Index. Each replica is a full copy of an index.
cluster.shardNumError: Number of Shards must be greater than or equal to 1.
cluster.rolloverError: Index rollover by capacity must be greater than 0.
cluster.enableRolloverByCapDesc: If you enabled this option, OpenSearch will rollover your index when index size reaches below specified size, regarless of the rollover time window. Note OpenSearch will append a 6-digit suffix to the index name automatically.
cluster.compressTypeDesc: Specify which compression type to use for this index. By default, the solution uses best_compression which uses DEFLATE for a higher compression ratio, at the expense of slighly slower stored fields performance. You can change to default if you prefer faster stored fields performance over index storage size.
cluster.warmImmediately: Move rollover index to warm storage immediately

s3.autoDesc: The Amazon S3 Access log is not enabled yet. The system will enable the access log and output to a system-managed Amazon S3 location.
s3.manualDesc: The Amazon S3 Access log has been enabled before. You need to select the Access log from a Amazon S3 location in current AWS account.
s3.title: Amazon S3
s3.alert: The Log Processing Layer must have access to Amazon S3.
s3.bucketDesc: Select an Amazon S3 bucket where you want to ingest its
s3.bucketEmptyError: Please select a Amazon S3 bucket
s3.notEnableTips: The bucket has not enabled Amazon S3 Access Log. The system will enable the logs.
s3.bucketNameDesc: Input the Bucket name which the Access Logs belongs to.
s3.s3LogLocationDesc: Specify the location of the Amazon S3 Access Log.
s3.s3LogLocationError: Please input Amazon S3 access log location
s3.savedTips: The bucket has Access Log saved at
s3.needEnableLogging: Please enable the Amazon S3 Access logging
s3.noLogOutputDesc: The log configuration of the selected bucket has not been enabled. Would you like to enable logging and output to the

desc.good1: Automatic enablement of Amazon S3 Access Logs

trail.alert: The Log Processing Layer must have access to the Amazon S3.
trail.logSourceDesc: Specify the CloudTrail log source location. By default, CloudTrail outputs the logs into a S3 bucket, if you had configured CloudTrail outputs logs to CloudWatch Logs, the solution also supports pulling logs from CloudWatch Logs.
trail.logSourceCWLDest: The trail is saved at the log group of
trail.alertCWL: The Log Processing Layer must have access to the CloudWatch Logs log group.
trail.noOutput: No log output to CloudWatch Logs
trail.noOutputDesc1: The solution detects that the selected Trail has not enabled log output to CloudWatch Logs. Would you like to enable logging and output to the
trail.noOutputDesc2:
log group? 
 Please note, standard CloudWatch and CloudWatch Logs charges apply.
trail.needEnableLogging: Please enable the CloudTrail Flow Log
trail.needSameRegion: Only supports CloudTrail Logs from Amazon S3 in same region, please manually change the s3 bucket and retry again.
trail.diffRegion: The trail is saved at {{bucket}} that is in a different region ({{logRegion}}) than the solution' home region ({{homeRegion}}). To proceed, please update the selected CloudTrail's logging configuration to deliver trails to a Amazon S3 bucket at {{homeRegion}} region.

rds.autoDesc: The system will detect the log location and enable the output to CloudWatch Logs if needed.
rds.manualDesc: Manually specify the RDS cluster identifier and the RDS log location.
rds.alert: The Log Processing Layer must have access to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
rds.enableAlert1: Enable Amazon RDS logs requires you have the correct Parameter Group. Find more information on
rds.enableAlert2: how to enable logs for an Amazon RDS MySQL instance
rds.logTypeDesc: Select the logs you want to ingest into OpenSearch domain.
rds.inputDBIDDesc: Input the identifier of the DB
rds.logLocationDesc: Select the log type and specify the CloudWatch Log Group ARN of the RDS ${conjection}.

cloudfront.autoDesc: The CloudFront logs is not enabled yet. The system will enable the standard logs and output to a system-managed Amazon S3 location.
cloudfront.manualDesc: The CloudFront standard logs has been enabled before. You need to select the logs from a Amazon S3 location in the current AWS account.
cloudfront.alert: The Log Processing Layer must have access to Amazon S3.
cloudfront.alertRealtime: The Log Processing Layer must have access to Amazon Kinesis Data Streams.
cloudfront.distributionDesc: Select an existing CloudFront Distribution from
cloudfront.cloudfrontWarning: This CloudFront Distribution has not enable access log yet, please choose another distribution.
cloudfront.distributionIdDesc: Input the CloudFront Distribution ID. This just for identification purpose.
cloudfront.logLocationDesc: Specify the location of the Standard Access Log.
cloudfront.logLocationError: Please input CloudFront Standard Log location
cloudfront.savedTips: The CloudFront Distribution has Access Log saved at
cloudfront.ingestedFieldsDesc: Select the CloudFront access log fields you want to ingest into the Amazon Elasticsearch cluster.
cloudfront.enrichedFieldsDesc: Enrich the CloudFront standard logs with additional informaiton. For example, the longtitude, latitude, city, state, country, OS and etc. The system use an open source library to enrich the data.
cloudfront.logTypeDesc: Specify what types of logs you want to collect.
cloudfront.existTipsDesc: The selected distribution has enabled real-time logs with an existing log configuration attached. To use this feature, the solution will create a new real-time log configuration to replace the existing one, please confirm to proceed.
cloudfront.noOutputDesc: The selected distribution has not enabled real-time logs. This solution will create real-time log configuration and attach to the selected distribution. Please confirm to proceed.
cloudfront.sampleRateDesc: Enter the percentage of log records delivered, from 1% to 100%.
cloudfront.sampleRateError: Sampling rate must be a number between 1 and 100.
cloudfront.fieldsDesc: Choose the fields to include in the real-time log configuration.
cloudfront.fieldsTips: Depends on your fields selection, some visualizations in the sample dashboard might not be available.
cloudfront.kdsShardNum: Kinesis Data Streams endpoint shard number
cloudfront.shardNumError: Shard Number must be greater than or equal to 1
cloudfront.kdsShardNumDesc: Specify the number of Shards of the Kinesis Data Streams. Each shard can have up to 1,000 records per second and total data write rate of 1MB per second.
cloudfront.enableAS: Enable auto scaling for the Kinesis Data Streams endpoint?
cloudfront.enableASDesc: Enable auto scaling of the Kinesis Data Streams shards?
cloudfront.kdsMaxShard: Maximum Shard number for Kinesis Data Streams endpoint
cloudfront.maxShardNumError: Max Shard Number must be greater than Shard number
cloudfront.manualNotSupportRTL: The solution does not support manual creation method for real-time logs now.
cloudfront.logProcessNotSupport: Fields enrichment is not supported for CloudFront realtime logs.
cloudfront.diffRegion: The Standard logs is saved at {{bucket}} that is in a different region ({{logRegion}}) than the solution' home region ({{homeRegion}}). To proceed, please update the selected CloudFront's logging configuration to deliver standard logs to a Amazon S3 bucket at {{homeRegion}} region.

lambda.alert: The Log Processing Layer must have access to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
lambda.name: Lambda
lambda.nameDesc: Select an existing Lambda function from

elb.autoDesc: The system will detect the log location and enable the log output if needed.
elb.manualDesc: Manually specify the source identifier and the location of log output.
elb.title: Elastic Load Balancer
elb.albDesc: Select the web ALB in your current AWS region & current AWS account.
elb.albNameDesc: Input the ALB name. This just for identification purpose.
elb.logLocationDesc: Specify log the location of the ALB logs.
elb.logLocationError: Please input ALB access log location
elb.elbEmptyError: Please select an Application Load Balancer
elb.savedTips: The ALB has Access Log saved at
elb.noLogOutputDesc: The log configuration of the selected ALB has not been enabled. Would you like to enable logging and output to the

waf.autoDesc: The system will detect the log location and enable the log output if needed.
waf.manualDesc: Manually specify the source identifier and the location of log output.
waf.title: AWS WAF
waf.aclDesc: Select the web ACL in your current AWS region & current AWS account.
waf.aclNameDesc: Input the Web ACL name. This just for identification purpose.
waf.logLocationDesc: Specify the log location of the Web ACL.
waf.logLocationError: Please input Web ACL access log location
waf.ingestOptionDesc: By default, the solution will ingest sampled requests.
waf.sampleScheduleDesc: How often you want to ingest sampled requests. (in Minutes)
waf.sampleScheduleError: Sampling Schedule must large than or equal 2 and less than 180
waf.savedTips: The Web ACL has Access Log saved at
waf.needEnableLogging: Please enable the Web ACL logging
waf.noLogOutputDesc: The log configuration of the selected Web ACL has not been enabled. Would you like to enable logging and output to the
waf.sourceWAFTip: Solution detects the selected WAF deliver its logs to Amazon S3 directly, the cost of this method is more expensive than delivering through Kinesis Data Firehose (KDF) to Amazon S3. If you want to switch to KDF, you can disable the logging of the select  WAF first, then Solution can automatically enable the KDF-based logging delivery method for you.
waf.sourceWAFTips1: Solution detects the web ACL's logs directly to
waf.sourceWAFTips2: the cost of this method is more expensive (
waf.sourceWAFTips4: ) than using the Kinesis Data Firehose (KDF) stream to collect and store to Amazon S3. If you want to switch to KDF, you can disable the log configuration of the WAF first, and then Solution can automatically enable the KDF-based log collection configuration for you and create a log analysis pipeline.

vpc.autoDesc: The VPC Flow Log is not enabled yet. The system will enable the log and output to a system-managed Amazon S3 location.
vpc.manualDesc: The VPC Flow Log has been enabled before. You need to select the log from a Amazon S3 location in current AWS account.
vpc.title: VPC Flow Log
vpc.alert: Only supports VPC Logs from Amazon S3 in same region, and the Log Processing Layer must have access to Amazon S3.
vpc.vpcDesc: Select an VPC where you want to ingest its
vpc.notEnableTips: The VPC has not enabled VPC Flow Logs. The system will enable the logs.
vpc.vpcNameDesc: Input the VPC ID which the VPC Flow Logs belongs to.
vpc.vpcLogLocationDesc: Specify the location of the VPC Flow Logs.
vpc.vpcLogLocationError: Please input VPC Flow Logs location
vpc.savedTips: The VPC Flow Logs is saved at
vpc.needEnableLogging: Please enable the VPC Flow Log
vpc.noLogOutputDesc: The log configuration of the selected VPC has not been enabled, or doesn't have Amazon S3 as log destination. Would you like to enable logging and output to the Amazon S3
vpc.logSourceDesc: Specify the VPC log source location.
vpc.logCWLEnabled1: The solution has create a flow log,
vpc.vpcNoOutput: No log output to CloudWatch Logs
vpc.vpcNoLogOutputDesc: The selected VPC has not enabled CloudWatch Logs as log destination. Would you like the solution to enable logging with CloudWatch Logs as destination? Please note, standard CloudWatch and CloudWatch Logs charges apply.
vpc.selectFlowLogDesc: Select a flow log to ingest into OpenSearch
vpc.flowLogLocationDesc: Specify the ARN of the CloudWatch Logs log group where the flow log stores.
vpc.alertCWL: The Log Processing Layer must have access to CloudWatch Logs log group.
vpc.needEnableLoggingCWL: Please enable the CloudWatch Logs as vpc flow log destination
vpc.selectVPCFlowLog: Please select a vpc flow log
vpc.diffRegion: The VPC Flow Logs is saved at {{bucket}} that is in a different region ({{logRegion}}) than the solution' home region ({{homeRegion}}). To proceed, please select a different flow log or allow the solution to create a new flow log for the selected VPC.

desc.good1: Automatic enablement of VPC Flow Logs

config.autoDesc: The system will detect the log location.
config.manualDesc: Manually specify the source identifier and the location of log output.
config.title: AWS Config
config.configNameDesc: Input the AWS Config name. This is just for identification purpose.
config.configNameEmptyError: The AWS Config name cannot be empty
config.logLocationDesc: Specify the log location of the AWS Config.
config.logLocationError: Please input AWS Config log location
config.savedTips: The AWS Config Log saved at
config.needEnableLogging: Please enable AWS Config in current region first, and make sure the Amazon S3 bucket which stores logs is same as the Solution region.
config.alreadyEnabled: Current Account AWS Config Log Ingestion  has been enabled. If you want to recreate an ingestion, please delete the previously ingestion first
